title: Pillow
text: A variant of the basic box-shaped pillow is the so-called "ingot shape" which resembles in profile, the general form of a Chinese silver ingot. This work displays a subtle, moulded design under its green and amber <I>san-ts'ai<I> glaze that simulates a brocaded textile. It may be that the pillow is actually meant to replicate a type of fabric covered cushion or pillow.
description: rectangular shape with slightly inverted center; tan and green striped glaze; decorated with stamped geometric designs and bird in a cartouche on each side
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
